item.title: Sainsbury's shopping trolley dumped on the awn fronting 1, Beech Tree Court, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands near the bus shelter and about 25m S of the jct with Valley Rd., 19th September
item.description:
Sainsbury's shopping trolley dumped on the awn fronting 1, Beech Tree Court, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands near the bus shelter and about 25m S of the jct with Valley Rd. It is immediately adjacent to the public footway and has perhaps been put on the lawn to stop it running downhill into busy traffic. Seen Friday 19/9/25 about 6pm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised flag obscuring traffic light, 19th September
item.description:
An unauthorised England flag affixed to nearby lamp column has slipped down so that it is partially obscuring the traffic lights for the pedestrian crossing on Erith Road (outside Civic Centre). This is positively dangerous as the signals are not clearly visible to drivers approaching the crossing. Please can the flag be removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous branches have now fallen, 19th September
item.description:
Dear all, a couple of weeks ago I reported that there were two large branches hanging dangerously, high up, not attached to the tree. Apparently you examined them and said they were fine and no action was required. As I had feared, both large branches (15ft long and 10inches thick) fell to the ground during the recent winds. You will be pleased to know that no one was injured or killed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
